page.title: 11FARMING - TYSOE - SMALL FARM
page.content: An analysis of the farms with houses close to the village reveals that they are farmed very much as they have been for generations. In fact one farmer has recently decided to revert to organic farming and discard the modern chemical methods methods. Much of the land is deep ridge and furrow and is crossed by many Public footpaths. Water comes from the Mains supply but a few fields are still fed from springs. Certain innovations have been incorporated over the years. The main changes are the general mechanisation, the lack of labour employed and the huge increase in prices and capital involved. These small family farmers are, in the main, optimistic about the future, and think that in spite of all hardships, farming in this area of Warwickshire will continue for many more years.
